label: HTML
description: HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is the standard markup language for creating web pages.

children.label: Elements
children.description: HTML elements are the building blocks of HTML pages.

children.label: <div>
children.description: Defines a division or a section in an HTML document.

children.label: <span>
children.description: Used to group inline-elements in a document.

children.label: <a>
children.description: Defines a hyperlink, linking to another location.
Embeds an image into the document.

children.label: <form>
children.description: Defines an HTML form for user input.

children.label: Attributes
children.description: HTML attributes provide additional information about elements.

children.label: class
children.description: Specifies one or more class names for an element.

children.label: id
children.description: Specifies a unique id for an element.

children.label: href
children.description: Specifies the URL of a linked resource.

children.label: src
children.description: Specifies the URL of an embedded resource.

children.label: alt
children.description: Specifies an alternative text for an image.

children.label: HTML5
children.description: HTML5 is the latest version of HTML with new elements, attributes, and behaviors.

children.label: Semantic Elements
children.description: Elements that clearly describe their meaning in a human- and machine-readable way.

children.label: <canvas>
children.description: Used to draw graphics via scripting (usually JavaScript).

children.label: <video>
children.description: Embeds a media player for video playback.

children.label: <audio>
children.description: Embeds a media player for audio playback.

children.label: CSS
children.description: CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) is a style sheet language used for describing the presentation of a document written in HTML or XML.

children.label: Stylesheets
children.description: CSS stylesheets describe how HTML elements are to be displayed.

children.label: Selectors
children.description: CSS selectors are used to select the content you want to style.

children.label: Properties
children.description: CSS properties are used to style and layout HTML elements.

children.label: JavaScript
children.description: JavaScript is a programming language that enables you to create dynamically updating content, control multimedia, animate images, and pretty much everything else.

children.label: DOM Manipulation
children.description: JavaScript can access and modify the content and structure of the DOM.

children.label: Events
children.description: JavaScript can be used to listen for and respond to events on HTML elements.

children.label: API Integration
children.description: JavaScript can be used to interact with various APIs to extend functionality.
